data.text: And after Elihu had ceased from speaking, the Lord spoke to Job through the whirlwind and clouds, saying,
Who is this that hides counsel from me,
Gird thy loins like a man;
Where wast thou when I founded the earth?
Who set the measures of it, if thou knowest?
On what are its rings fastened?
When the stars were made,
And I shut up the sea with gates,
And I made a cloud its clothing,
And I set bounds to it,
And I said to it, Hitherto shalt thou come, but thou shalt not go beyond,
Or did I order the morning light in thy time;
To lay hold of the extremities of the earth,
Or didst thou take clay of the ground, and form a living creature,
And hast thou removed light from the ungodly,
Or hast thou gone to the source of the sea,
And do the gates of death open to thee for fear;
And hast thou been instructed in the breadth of the whole earth under heaven?
And in what kind of a land does the light dwell?
If thou couldest bring me to their utmost boundaries,
I know then that thou wert born at that time,
But hast thou gone to the treasures of snow?
And is there a store of them,
And whence proceeds the frost?
And who prepared a course for the violent rain,
To rain upon the land where there is no man,
And cause it to send forth a crop of green herbs?
Who is the rainâ€™s father?
And out of whose womb comes the ice?
Which descends like flowing water? who has terrified the face of the ungodly?
And dost thou understand the band of Pleiades,
Or wilt thou reveal Mazzaroth in his season,
And knowest thou the changes of heaven,
And wilt thou call a cloud with thy voice,
And wilt thou send lightnings, and they shall go?
And who has given to women skill in weaving,
And who is he that numbers the clouds in wisdom,
For it is spread out as dusty earth,
And wilt thou hunt a prey for the lions?
For they fear in their lairs,
And who has prepared food for the raven?
